results.title: The Vanishing (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Larry Brezner, Paul Schiff and George Sluizer
results.brief_description: After his girl friend mysteriously disappears at a petrol station, Jeff (Kiefer Sutherland) begins a year long quest to find her. Not even a new love (Nancy Travis), can distract him, and after much secrecy he is forced to bring her in on his quest. Unknown to Jeff, he himself is being stalked by the calculating psychopath (Jeff Bridges), responsible for kidnapping his girlfriend in the first place. Jeff and his new girlfriend are led on a chilling reenactment of the fate that occurred a year ago. Cast includes Kiefer Sutherland, Sandra Bullock, Nancy Travis, Park Overall and Maggie Linderman. This is a remake of director Sluizer’s 1988 Dutch version (302156).

results.title: The Vanishing
results.creator_credit: Golden Egg Film, Ingrid Production, Anne Lordon and George Sluizer
results.brief_description: Based on the story “The golden egg” by Tim Krabbe, “The vanishing” is an extraordinary and chilling study of obsession which investigates the edges of rationality and the destructive capacity of idealistic devotion.

results.title: The Vanished vikings. Part 2: Where did they go?
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In the 16th century European explorers found no Viking settlements in Greenland - only bones and ruins. This film introduces the leading theories about the sudden disappearance of some 9000 Viking people and follows the points of view of leading scholars. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Vanished vikings. Part 1: Erik the Red
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In 986 A.D. Erik the Red and his Vikings left Iceland and establish settlements in Greenland that were thought to be continuously occupied for 500 years before suddenly ceasing to exist. Traces Erik’s travels, using sagas as well as archaeological evidence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Van
results.creator_credit: Lynda Myles, BBC, Deadly Films and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set during the 1989 World Cup season when Ireland’s national identity is intricately wrapped up in its sporting success, “The Van” follows the relationship of lifelong friends, Brendan (Bimbo) and Larry. Larry, long time unemployed and living on welfare, finds his professional friend Bimbo joining the ranks of the unemployed when he is retrenched. With the help of a dodgy associate, Bimbo purchases a dilapidated van and miraculously cleans it up to create the modest business enterprise of Bimbo’s Burgers. He asks his best mate Larry to work for him, and soon Larry’s daughter Diane and vegetarian son Kevin begin work with them to cater for the soccer, beach and concert crowds. As the pressure of working long hours, meeting stringent health regulations and Bimbo’s dismay at Larry’s work ethic weighs on them, Larry and Bimbo push the boundaries of their relationship, forcing them to choose between being partners and being friends. With a soundtrack by Eric Clapton, “The Van” is the final chapter in Roddy Doyle’s Barrytown trilogy. Cast includes Colm Meaney, Donal O’Kelly, Neili Conroy and Ger Ryan.

results.title: The Van
results.creator_credit: Paul Lewis, Crown International Pictures and Sam Grossman
results.brief_description: Bobby is a young man, just graduated from High School, who imagines himself in a sexual situation with every attractive woman that he encounters. The reality is that Bobby is single, but his investment in new wheels brings with it the potential for real sexual experience. The van in question is a souped up vehicle complete with waterbed, plush interior and mirrors on the ceiling. Bobby’s investment in the van is threatened when a friend in trouble desperately needs his car loan repayment money. Simultaneously Bobby falls for a local girl, who challenges Bobby’s desire to sleep with a bevy of women. This film often skips into dream mode, whence the audience witnesses the sexual fantasy of various characters as they gaze upon a particular scene or person. This film is in part a curio from the 1970s that documents a car culture fetish and a male desire to assuage ego with sexual experiences. Features Danny De Vito in a minor role.

results.title: The Valley revisited
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Tennessee Valley Authority was the largest project undertaken by President Roosevelt’s Works Project Administration, transforming a malarial floodplain into a prosperous agricultural region and improving the living and working conditions for those who lived on the plain. President Kennedy’s vulnerability at his address when he visited the Project for the 30th anniversary celebrations on 18 May 1963 prefigured his assassination six months later.

results.title: The Valley of the Tennessee
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information and Alexander Hammid
results.brief_description: A moving and human story of the work of the TVA in rescuing the people of the Tennessee Valley from floods and erosion. The river’s energy was running to waste, and floods were frequent and tragic; the once-good soil was deteriorating from erosion and over-cropping; the farmers struggled on in poverty and hopelessness. The Tennessee Valley Authority was created to build dams, to control the floods, to use the water for irrigation, hydro-electricity and navigation, to restore the Valley to prosperity again. Most of the farmers, sunk in poverty and despair, proved difficult to help, but gradually the younger ones among them were won over, first to interest, and then to enthusiasm and co-operation. As a result of years of work, and increasing self help and experiment on the part of the farmers working with TVA, the great Valley of the Tennessee, larger in area that the United Kingdom, has been restored in some measure to fertility and prosperity. This film is remarkable for its treatment of larger issues through the reactions of individuals-in particular, a child, a young farmer, and an old farmer-and the economy and insight of its visuals. Script by May Sarton. Photographed by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: The Valley
results.brief_description: A before and after story of the pollution of the Ohio River Valley. The pollution included sewage, industrial waste and mining pollution. The controls: monitoring of the rivers conditions, and enforcement of regulations governing the disposal of waste material have contributed to the improvement of the area.

results.title: The Valley
results.creator_credit: Katherine Scholes, Edward Street Films and Roger Scholes
results.brief_description: Produced with the co-operation of the local community and World Vision Ethiopia staff in the Omo Valley, this film traces transformation of an area devastated by drought and land degradation into green and productive land, reversing the trend of environmental destruction and poverty.
